page.title: 06Education 3 - Llanarth Ct
page.content:
Roch House was built in 1976 and has 9 classrooms on the ground floor, and dormitories on the second floor for the 1st to 4th year children. There is 1 monk, one lay staff, and a nurse living in the building.
The Stable Blocks were originally stables when the school was owned by the Herberts. Over the past 20 years they have been used as classrooms. The stables are in a rectangular form with an arched entrance. Converted classrooms include a junior science lab, music room and an art room. Linked to the Stable block is a sports hall. Other activities taking place around the stable block include woodwork, shooting (on a range) and judo takes place in the gymnasium.
